Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This form of message passing, supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one (all desired by branch members) in a flexible, low overhead manner.  It has been common for telemetry packets to be sent to many destinations, such as a real-time telemetry.

Summary: SB: Send Message - Message ID To Pipe Limit
Description: The cFE shall limit the number of messages of a particular Message ID that can be sent to an Application's Pipe.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Prevent an errant application from monopolizing a Software Bus Pipe. This feature was part of the heritage software bus and was found to be a useful diagnostic feature.  When subscribing to a packet, an Application can specify a limit on the number of Messages for a particular Message ID that can be in the Pipe at one time. The term used for this is MsgId-to-Pipe Limit.

Description: If routing a Message to an Application's Pipe results in a Pipe Overflow, the cFE shall abort the send to that pipe, issue an event, and continue sending to the remaining pipes.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs to know if a message cannot be routed to its destination. A Pipe Overflow occurs when the SB attempts to write to a Pipe that is completely full of SB messages. The number of messages a Pipe is capable of storing is defined by a platform configuration parameter.

Summary: SB: Send Message - Exceed Message ID To Pipe Limit
Description: If routing a Message to an Application's Pipe would exceed the MsgId-to-Pipe Limit, the cFE shall abort the send to that pipe, issue an event, and continue sending to the remaining pipes.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs to know if a message cannot be routed to its destination. The MsgId-to-Pipe Limit is exceeded when the SB attempts to write to a Pipe that contains the maximum number of messages of a particular Message Id.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request to send a Message, if no Application's have Subscribed to the Message, the cFE shall increment the No Subscriber's Counter and send an event that displays the Message ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A single counter is enough to notify operators that there are no receivers for a packet that is being sent. The no subscribers event is completely filtered by default. The ground can unfilter the no subscribers event to get more information about the message. It is not considered an error if no Applications have subscribed because of the dynamic environment supported by the cFE. In addition, during initialization of a multi-processor system, this can easily occur.

Description: If the SB Message is greater than the `<MISSION_DEFINED>` maximum message size then the cFE shall not send the message, issue and event message and increment the message send error counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE should not make any assumptions about why the message was too big and just not send it.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request to receive a SB Message from a Pipe without a timeout, the cFE shall remove the next SB Message from the Pipe and provide the message to the Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Applications need a mechanism to retrieve the SB Message they have subscribed to receive. A receive Request without a suspension timeout provides a non-blocking method of retrieving SB messages. Receives are performed on a Pipe basis not on a SB Message basis. The heritage SB Pipe-based receives have served us well. A message-based receive would add extra complexity without any real benefit.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request to receive a SB Message from a Pipe with a pending timeout, the cFE shall suspend execution of the Application until a SB Message is present on the Pipe or the timeout has expired.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A receive Request with a suspension timeout provides a blocking method of retrieving SB messages. This is useful for data driven Applications and has been used on all heritage missions with a SB. The timeout is useful for fault recovery for Applications that always expect data to arrive or to allow periodic processing for Applications that are not purely data driven. If a SB Message is queued on the Pipe then the SB Message will be provided to the Application and the Applications execution will not be suspended. Tasks that process telemetry packets often receive many types of packets from different sources.  There should be a mechanism that allows a task to wait for many different types of messages simultaneously.  Heritage implementations of SB do this by directing the messages into one queue (or several queues, to implement priority levels).

Description: Upon receipt of a Request to receive a SB Message from a Pipe with an infinite timeout, the cFE shall suspend execution of the Application until a SB Message is present on the Pipe.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This mode of receiving has been the most commonly used mode on the heritage SB.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the message ID of the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the received message with the received message ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the requested string from the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested message with the requested string.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall initialize the requested message with the requested message ID and length.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide a pointer to the user data of the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the user data length of the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested message with the requested user data length.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the total message length of the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested message with the requested total message length.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the time from the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested message with the requested time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested message with the current time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the command code from the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested message with the requested command code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested message with the current checksum.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the checksum validation result of the requested message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall set the requested pipe with the requested options.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Pipe management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the pipe options of the requested pipe.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Pipe management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall establish a route for a requested local message ID on the requested pipe using the '<MISSION_DEFINED>' default quality of service.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Subscription management, where subscription is to a message local to this cFE instance.  Typically used by software bus network applications.

Summary: SB: Subscribe to Message With Defaults
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall establish a route for the requested message ID on the requested pipe, using the '<MISSION_DEFINED>' default quality of service and message limit.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Subscription management.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall remove the route for the requested local message ID on the requested pipe.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Subscription management, where unsubscribe is to a message local to this cFE instance. Typically used by software bus network applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall route the requested message to all subscribed pipes without updating the sequence count.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message publication capability without modifying the message.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the result of comparing the requested message IDs as equal or not equal.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the integer conversion of the requested message ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the message ID conversion of the provided integer.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Message management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the pipe name given the requested pipe ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Pipe management utility.

Summary: SB: Get Pipe ID By Name
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the pipe ID for the requested pipe name.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Pipe management utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide a pointer to support routing a zero copy message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Zero copy message passing support for reduced overhead at the cost of additional pointer management.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall release the requested zero copy pointer.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Zero copy message passing support for reduced overhead at the cost of additional pointer management.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall route the requested zero copy message to all subscribed pipes.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Zero copy message passing support for reduced overhead at the cost of additional pointer management.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall route the requested zero copy message to all subscribed pipes without updating the message sequence counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Zero copy message passing support for reduced overhead at the cost of additional pointer management.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall provide the message packet type.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to get the packet type (command or telemetry).

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the validation status of the message ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to validate a message ID.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall set the message packet type.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to set the packet type (command or telemetry).

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall provide the requested message header field.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to get implementation defined header fields.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall set the requested message header field.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to set implementation defined header fields.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall provide the message sequence count.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to get the message sequence count.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall set the message sequence count.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to set the message sequence count.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall provide the next message sequence count.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to get the next message sequence count value such that rollovers are handled based on the implemented field size.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the CFE shall provide the message type associated with the requested message ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides abstraction for apps to get the message type given only the message ID.  Supports a variety of implementations allowing for efficient message ID use (supports bit, range, table, or other logic).

Summary: SB: Initialize Routing On Power On Reset
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset the cFE shall initialize the Routing Information and clear all error counters.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE must initialize to a known state.

Summary: SB: Initialize Routing On Processor Reset
Description: Upon a Processor Reset the cFE shall initialize the Routing Information and clear all error counters
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE must initialize to a known state.

Summary: TBL: Load Inactive Table From File
Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall load an Inactive Table Image with the contents of the Command specified File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Loading from a file allows for multiple versions of a table to be stored on board and loaded to the active table when appropriate. The file header will identify the Table that the file contents are for.

Summary: TBL: Load Inactive Table From File - Partial Load
Description: If the Command specified file contains only a portion of the Table, the cFE shall first load an Inactive Table Image with the contents of the Active Table Image and then load the contents of the Command specified File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A Partial Table load capability is useful when dealing with large Tables.  It helps to ensure that additional parameters are not unintentionally modified, reduces command time required to perform a Table update and is a feature that has been used on previous missions.

Summary: TBL: Load Inactive Table From File - Greater Than Max Size
Description: If the number of data bytes contained in the file is greater than the maximum size of the table, the load shall be aborted and an event message shall be generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This is a sanity check to make sure that the ground generated table load does not include more data than a table can handle.

Summary: TBL: Load Inactive Table From File - Header Size Mismatch
Description: If the number of bytes specified in the file's header is not equal to the number of data bytes contained in the file, the load shall be aborted and an event message be generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This is another sanity check to make sure that the number of bytes specified in the file header is equal to the number of data bytes in the file.

Summary: TBL: Load Inactive Table From File - Multiple Partial Loads
Description: The Inactive Table Image shall only be loaded with the contents of the Active Table if the Inactive Table Image has not been initialized.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to perform successive partial table loads.  The first partial load of a table requires that the inactive table image be initialized with the active table image (see cTBL6000.2).  Any subsequent loads should be made with the existing contents of the Inactive Buffer.

Summary: TBL: Load Inactive Table From File - Dump Only
Description: If the specified table is defined as Dump Only then the command shall be rejected and an event message be generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Dump only tables can't be loaded.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall dump the Command specified Active or Inactive Table contents to a Command specified File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Dumping the contents of a table to a file simplifies the telemetering of Table contents.  The file transfer protocol between the ground and the spacecraft is capable of handling variable sized files.  The telemetering of Table contents directly to ground.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall determine the validity of the contents of either the Active or Inactive Table Image of the Command specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operations needs to verify the contents of an Inactive Table before committing it. Similarly, operations personnel may need to re-validate or identify the contents of an Active Table.

Summary: TBL: Validate - Compute Data Integrity Check Value
Description: The cFE shall compute a Data Integrity Check Value on the contents of either the Active or Inactive Table Image of the Command specified Table and report the result in telemetry.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A Data Integrity Check Value can provide a quick method of validating the proper contents of a Table without performing a Table Dump and Comparison.

Description: The cFE shall Request an Application to validate the contents of either the Active or Inactive Table Image of the Command specified Table and report the result in telemetry.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A Table Validation function provided by the Application can verify that the data content of a Table is reasonable.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall make an Inactive Table Image of the Command specified Table the Active Table Image.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A Commit Command is useful by allowing modifications and the verification of those modifications to be accomplished in the background while an Application continues to use its previous Table data.  Then, upon Command, the new Table data is made Active.

Description: The cFE shall reject an activate table command for a table that has a validation function but has not been validated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Validation functions are there for a reason so want to prevent loading invalid tables.  Inactive buffer retains the data so that the ground can dump the contents to see why the validation failed.

Description: If the Inactive Table Image fails validation, the Inactive Table Image shall not be loaded into the Active Table Image.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Prevent loading of an invalid table. Note that the Inactive Table still contains the table image so that the ground can dump it.

Summary: TBL: Activate - Validate - No Validation Function
Description: If a Table Validation Function does not exist for the specified Table, the Table shall be considered valid.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If there is no validation function, assume the table has good data in it (no way to check otherwise).

Summary: TBL: Write Table Registry To File
Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall write the contents of the Table Registry to a file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Table Registry will provide a list of the Tables currently registered, their attributes (double or single-buffered, dump-only, etc), a history of what files were last loaded into the Active Table Images, what time the load occurred and whether the image has been modified via Partial Table Load.

Summary: TBL: Write Table Registry To File - Default File Name
Description: If a file is not specified, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` filename.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide a default in the event that a user does not want to specify one.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall telemeter the contents of the Table Registry associated with a Command specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operations personnel may wish to see the attributes (double or single-buffered, dump-only, etc), a history of what file(s) was/were last loaded into the Active Table Image, what time the load(s) occurred, etc.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall generate a NO-OP event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is useful as a general sub-system aliveness test.

Description:
Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall set the following counters reported in telemetry to zero:

- Valid Command Counter
- Invalid Command Counter
- Number of Validation Requests
- Number of successful Table Validations
- Number of Unsuccessful Validations
- Number of Completed Validations
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is a common feature in heritage sub-system software design.

Description: Upon receipt of valid command, the cFE shall increment the valid command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs the capability to verify that the command was received and accepted by the cFE.  Details of valid commands are documented in the cFE User's Guide.

Description: Upon receipt of an invalid command, the cFE shall in increment the invalid command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs an indicator if a command is rejected by the cFE. Details of what makes a command invalid are documented in the cFE User's Guide.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Message, the cFE shall generate a housekeeping message that includes the following Table Services items:

- Valid Command Counter
- Invalid Command Counter
- Number of Tables Currently Registered
- Table Identifier of Last Table Modified
- Time of Last Table Modification
- Source Filename of Last Table Load
- Destination Filename of Last Table Dump
- Table Identifier of Commanded Data Integrity Check
- Commanded Data Integrity Check Value
- Commanded Table Verification Function Result
- Number of unused Shared Buffers
- Table Name of Last Table Load
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Generate housekeeping message for system awareness and management.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall abort the loading of the specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs a way to clear the inactive buffer of all loads in the event, for example, that erroneous values were loaded to the table by the ground. Note that once a table is activated, it cannot be aborted (significant for double-buffer tables).

Summary: TBL: Abort Load - Release Shared Buffer
Description: If the Table buffering characteristics for the specified Table indicate that it is a Single-buffered Table, then the allocated shared buffer shall be released.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The shared buffer being used for this table load should be placed back into the pool of available shared buffers.

Summary: TBL: Abort Load - Mark Inactive Buffer Uninitialized
Description: If the Table buffering characteristics for the specified Table indicate that it is a Double-buffered table, then the inactive buffer shall be marked as uninitialized.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make sure that the table image gets re-initialized with the contents of the active buffer prior to a subsequent load after an abort command is sent (see cTBL6000.4)

Summary: TBL: Abort Load - No Loads Pending
Description: The Table Registry shall indicate that there are no loads pending for the specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Maintain current table status in table registry.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command the cFE shall delete the requested table CDS data.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): CDS management for a table no longer in use.

Summary: TBL: Delete CDS - Table In Use
Description: If the specified Table is in use the command shall be rejected and an event message generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Reject if table is in use.

Summary: TBL: Delete CDS - Not Critical Table
Description: If the specified table is not a critical table, the command shall be rejected and an event message generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Reject when not a critical table.

Description: If the specified Table CDS has already been deleted the command shall be rejected and an event message generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Reject if table CDS has already been deleted.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall create a zero filled Table Image with the Request specified name, size, buffering characteristics (single or double-buffer), dump-only characteristics, criticality and Table Validation Function address.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports the cFE's dynamic Application model. Tables will be able to be either single or double-buffered.  Double buffering will allow instantaneous updates from the Application's point of view and will be useful for interrupt service routines, etc.  However, double buffering will consume more memory resources.  The Table Validation Function is optionally provided by the Application and is called when a Command to Validate the table is made. Note that a zero filled image will not be created if the Application specifies an address for the dump-only table (see cTBL6300.1).

Summary: TBL: Create - App Supplied Address For Dump Only
Description: The cFE shall allow an Application to specify an address as the one and only buffer for a dump-only Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Heritage code allowed for dump only tables to come from an address instead of a true table.  In this case, table services does not allocate any memory for the dump only table.  This is referred to an Application-Defined-Address-Table.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall initialize the contents of the Request specified Table Image with the contents of the Request specified File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports the cFE's dynamic Application model.

Summary: TBL: Initialize Contents - Greater Than Max Size
Description: If the Request specified File contains more data than the size of the Request specified Table, the Table Image will not be initialized and an Event Message shall be generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If a File contains more data than memory allows, there is a high likelihood that the Application is expecting the data to be in a different format.  Additionally, the cFE would not know whether to throw out the last part or the first part of the data.

Description: If the Request specified File contains less data than the size of the Request specified Table, the first portion of the Table Image will be initialized with the contents of the File and an Event Message shall be generated.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Some tables may allocate more space than is necessary at all times. The Event Message will serve as a warning but not prevent the initialization of the Table.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall provide the calling Application with a unique identifier of an existing Table Image.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Some Applications will not want to create a Table but obtain a handle to one that is created by another Application.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall free resources allocated for the Request specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports the cFE's dynamic Application model.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall provide the calling Application with the address of the Request specified Table data.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Table Service 'owns' all Tables and Applications must ask for the current address of the data because the Table Service may move the Table as updates are made.

Summary: TBL: Provide Data Address - Lock Contents
Description: Upon providing a calling Application with the address of a Table's data, the cFE shall lock the contents of the Table to prevent modification.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Table Service must wait for an Application to be done with the contents of the Table before considering modifying its contents.  This ensures data integrity while the Application accesses the Table contents. More than one Application can access a Table.  Therefore, a reference count will be necessary to ensure that all access is complete before a Table can be modified.

Summary: TBL: Provide Data Address - Modified Notification
Description: If a Table has been modified since the last Table address request, the cFE shall notify the calling Application that the Table has been modified.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): An Application may need to know when the contents of a Table have been updated.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall unlock the contents of the Request specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Table Service must wait for an Application to be done with the contents of the Table before considering modifying its contents.  This ensures data integrity while the Application accesses the Table contents. More than one Application can access a Table.  Therefore, a reference count will be necessary to ensure that all access is complete before a Table can be modified.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall update the request specified Table if a load is pending and it is unlocked.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This gives control to the Application as to when the table update occurs.

Summary: TBL: Update With Pending Load - Locked
Description: If a Table is locked when an update Request is made, an appropriate error code shall be returned to the calling Application and the update shall not occur.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Application should be made aware that the table is not being updated because it is locked.

Description:
Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall provide the following information to the calling Application for the specified Table:

- Size of the table
- Number of Users the access to the table (sharing)
- Filename of the last file used to modify the table
- File creation time of last file used to modify the table
- Time of last modification
- Flag indicating if the Table has been initialized
- Flag indicating if the Table is dump only
- Flag indicating if the Table has a dedicated buffer
- Flag indicating if the table is maintained in the Critical Data Store
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Applications such as Checksum need to obtain info such as size of the table.    The API is a more generic solution.

Description: Upon receipt of Request the cFE shall indicate if the specified table has a validation, update, or dump pending.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Applications must periodically check to see if they need to perform updates, validations or dumps.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall provide the calling Application with the addresses of the data for the tables requested if more than one table is needed.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Applications may need to work with more than one table at a time.

Summary: TBL: Provide Data Addresses - Lock Contents
Description: Upon providing a calling Application with the addresses of a Tables' data, the cFE shall lock the contents of the Tables to prevent modification.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Table Service must wait for an Application to be done with the contents of the Table before considering modifying its contents.  This ensures data integrity while the Application accesses the Table contents.

Summary: TBL: Provide Data Addresses - Modified Notification
Description: If at least one Table has been modified since the last Table addresses request, the cFE shall notify the calling Application that a Table has been modified.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): An Application may need to know when the contents of a Tables has been updated; the Application just won't know which one.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall unlock the contents of the Request specified Tables.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Applications may need to work with more than one table at a time.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request the cFE shall determine the validity of the contents of either the Active or Inactive Table Image of the requested Table if a validation request is pending.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Performs table validation if a validation request is pending. This check is nominally performed during table management when validation has been requested but can performed independent of table management.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request the cFE shall dump the requested Table to a buffer if a dump request is pending.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Performs table dump to a buffer if a dump request is pending. This check is nominally performed during table management when a dump has been requested but can performed independent of table management.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall perform the following actions on a Table:

- Update critical table data in CDS
- Update the time of last modification
- Update the CRC
- Update the last loaded filename with modified indicator
- Flag the update notification for other applications
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Capability to request cFE to perform maintenance on a table that has been modified by an application.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall perform the following actions on a table:

- Validate Table if request pending
- Dump Table if request pending
- Update Table if request pending
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Capability to process standard pending requests on a table.

Summary: TBL: Free Resources On Power On Reset
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset all Table resources shall be freed.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Table Service cannot assume the contents of any Table is legitimate after a reset.

Summary: TBL: Free Resources On Processor Reset
Description: Upon a Processor Reset all Table resources shall be freed.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Table Service cannot assume the contents of any Table is legitimate after a reset.

Summary: TBL: Free Resources On Processor Reset - Preserve Critical
Description: If the Table is a critical table then the contents of the Table shall be preserved.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Goal of a processor reset is to preserve certain data to facilitate recovery.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Message, the cFE shall generate a housekeeping message that includes the following Time Services items:

- Time Status
- MET
- STCF
- Leap Seconds
- STCF continuous adjustment value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Generate housekeeping message for system awareness and management.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall generate a NO-OP event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is useful as a general sub-system aliveness test.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall set to zero all counters reported in Time Services telemetry.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is a common feature in heritage sub-system software design.

Description: Upon receipt of valid command, the cFE shall increment the valid command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs the capability to verify that the command was received and accepted by the cFE.  Details of valid commands are documented in the cFE User's Guide.

Description: Upon receipt of an invalid command, the cFE shall in increment the invalid command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs an indicator if a command is rejected by the cFE. Details of what makes a command invalid are documented in the cFE User's Guide.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall set the number of Leap Seconds to the Command-specified value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The decision to introduce a leap second in UTC is the responsibility of the International Earth Rotation Service (IERS).  The count of Leap Seconds has been incremented about every 500 days since 1972.  It is therefore likely that a mission will need to update.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall set the STCF to the Command specified value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE must be provided with the appropriate correlation factor, that when combined with the current MET and Leap Seconds values, will result in current time. Historically this command has been referred to as 'jam loading' time.

Summary: TIME: Update STCF Given Current Time
Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall compute a new value for STCF using the Command-specified value as current time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command provides a useful alternative to setting the STCF explicitly, as the command does not require knowledge of the current MET value. If the default time format is TAI, the new value for STCF is the Command-specified time value less MET.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall make a continuous 1Hz delta adjustment to the STCF by the Command-specified value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Upon receipt of a Command to make a 'continuous' adjustment to the STCF, the cFE shall adjust the STCF each second by the Command-specified value. The commanded value is signed so a positive or negative adjustment may be made.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall switch to the Command-specified Tone Signal source.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The behavior of this command is hardware specific but provides the capability to command Tone Signal source selection if implemented at the hardware level.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall generate a Software Bus message that includes time diagnostic information.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): When testing or debugging the time application, more details about time services are required.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE Time Services shall set the External Time Update Mode to the specified value, either use or ignore Tone Signal and Data when updating time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Historically referred to as forced flywheeling.  This provides an easy way to test local time calculations and compare against external time or force internal timekeeping operationally.

Summary: TIME: External Time Update Mode - Ignore Updates
Description: The cFE shall propagate time internally when set to ignore external time updates.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ignore external time updates and update time internally when configured to do so.  Will still accept Tone Signal and Data but won't update timekeeping based on the externally provided timing information.

Summary: TIME: External Time Update Mode - Use Updates
Description: The cFE shall update timekeeping when a Tone Signal and Data pair have been received when set to use external time updates.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Use external time updates to update timekeeping values when configured to do so.  Timekeeping in this context is intentionally vague since it depends on system mode, configuration and hardware implementation.  This requirement just covers using the external data, not how exactly it is used.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall add the Command specified value to SCTF.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): One-time (aka jump) value added to SCTF supports time adjustment for time servers or time clients that are set to ignore external Tone updates.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall subtract the Command specified value from SCTF.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): One-time (aka jump) value subtracted from SCTF supports time adjustment for time servers or time clients that are set to ignore external Tone updates.

Description: Upon receipt of a Message, the cFE shall generate a message that contains Tone Data.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enables scheduler or another app to schedule time at tone data messages.

Description: Upon receipt of a Message, the cFE shall update timekeeping if a paired Tone Signal has been received.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Once a Tone Data and Signal pair are received, timekeeping will be updated if External Data Use is enabled.  Paired statement allows for time is or time was configuration (Data before or after Signal).

Description: Upon receipt of a Message, the cFE shall update timekeeping if paired Tone Data has been received.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Once a Tone Data and Signal pair are received, timekeeping will be updated if External Data Use is enabled.  Paired statement allows for time is or time was configuration (Data before or after Signal).

Description: Upon receipt of a Message, the cFE shall trigger the 1 Hz processing cycle.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allows message triggered 1 Hz processing to support synchronization.  Processing depends on configuration such as registered synchronization callbacks, virtualized MET, etc so it's left as generic language in this requirement.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall update MET with the provided value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Hardware and configuration dependent command allows the capability to set MET if it is supported.  If not utilizing a virtual MET, the hardware will reject the command if not supported.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall adjust timekeeping by adding the provided delta time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Capability to adjust timekeeping independent of Tone and SCTF.  Used to tune a system given Tone, 1Hz, or MET external dependencies.  Timekeeping here remains abstract since it's dependent on configuration and mode governed by other requirements.  Delta time persists until removed (independent of other external updates).

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall adjust timekeeping by subtracting the provided delta time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Capability to adjust timekeeping independent of Tone and SCTF. Used to tune a system given Tone, 1Hz, or MET external dependencies. Timekeeping here remains abstract since it's dependent on configuration and mode governed by other requirements. Delta time persists until removed (independent of other external updates).

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the TAI.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the TAI available to applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the UTC.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the UTC available to applications.

Summary: TIME: Provide Time in Default Format
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the current time computed in the default selection of UTC or TAI.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): One of the mission defined selections is the choice of whether TAI or UTC will be the default time format.  And most callers do not care which time format is the current default.  This function avoids having to modify each individual caller when the default is requested.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the MET.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the MET available to applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the MET seconds.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the MET seconds available to applications.  This capability simplifies application logic.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the MET sub-seconds.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the MET sub-seconds available to applications.  This capability simplifies application logic.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the STCF.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the STCF available to applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the Leap Seconds.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the Leap Seconds available to applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the Clock State.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to make the Clock State available to applications.  Due to lack of a demonstrable use case, the requirement to provide clock state data as part of 'get time' functions has been deleted.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the result of adding the two requested time values.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to provide a common time addition function available to applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the result of subtracting the two requested time values.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to provide a common time subtraction function available to applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the result of comparing the two requested time values.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to provide a common time comparison function available to applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the micro-second conversion of the requested sub-seconds value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Converting elapsed time from sub-seconds to micro-seconds is a commonly used conversion utility.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the sub-second conversion of the requested micro-second value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Abstract conversion support.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the requested time value in the following format: `yyyy-ddd-hh:mm:ss.xxxxx\0`
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Converts the requested time value into a readable string format.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall update timekeeping based on the requested MET and provide a corresponding Tone Data message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Trigger to create Tone Data message given external MET.

Summary: TIME: Tone Data Given Time and Leap Seconds
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall update timekeeping based on the requested time and leap seconds and provide a corresponding Tone Data message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Trigger to create Tone Data message given external time and leap seconds, typical of a GPS based timing system.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall update timekeeping based on the requested Time and provide a corresponding Tone Data message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Trigger to create Tone Data message given external time.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall register the requested function for callback upon receipt of Tone Signal.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Manage synchronization of calls at receipt of Tone Signal.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall unregister the requested function for callback upon receipt of Tone Signal.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Manage synchronization of calls at receipt of Tone Signal.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the clock state flags.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides clock state converted to flag values.

Summary: TIME: Convert MET to Spacecraft Time
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall convert the provided MET to spacecraft time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Converts the provided MET to spacecraft time based on current configuration of the system.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall trigger the 1 Hz processing cycle.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allows API triggered 1 Hz processing to support synchronization. Processing depends on configuration such as registered synchronization callbacks, virtualized MET, etc so it's left as generic language in this requirement.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall trigger the Tone Signal processing cycle.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allows API triggered Tone Signal processing to support synchronization. Processing depends on configuration such as registered synchronization callbacks, virtualized MET, etc so it's left as generic language in this requirement.

Summary: TIME: Power On Reset Default Values
Description:
Upon a Power-on Reset the cFE shall set the following time elements to their `<MISSION_DEFINED>` default values:

- Time Status Data
- STCF
- Leap Seconds
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): At power on, the presumption is that the MET h/w register has been reset.  It is common to set the STCF and Leap Seconds at startup such that time is computed to a known and recognizable value.

Description:
Upon a Processor Reset the cFE shall acquire the following time elements from the `<MISSION_DEFINED>` Critical Data Store:

- Time Status Data
- STCF
- Leap Seconds
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Time is a critical system resource and every effort should be made to preserve it.  Following a processor reset, the presumption is that the MET h/w register is unaffected and that previously 'good' values for STCF and Leap Seconds can still be used to correct.

Description: Upon a Processor Reset the cFE shall verify the Critical Data Store used to store time values.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Verification of potentially damaged stored data is a standard practice.  Note that because time can be any value, verification potentially involves using a pattern.

Summary: TIME: Processor Reset Verify CDS - Initialize On Failure
Description: If the critical data store is not valid, all of the time elements shall be initialized in the same fashion as following a power-on reset.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If the CDS can't be trusted, initialize to default values.

Description:
During normal operation, the cFE shall preserve the following time elements in the `<MISSION_DEFINED>` Critical Data Store:

- Time Status Data
- STCF
- Leap Seconds
- MET
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Time is a critical system resource and every effort should be made to preserve it.  Preserving time allows applications to 'fly through' resets.
